tn.text: Paul continues giving Titus reasons to preach God's word, how the older men, older women, young men, and slaves or servants should live as believers.
Paul implies what is in contrast. AT: "But you, Titus, in contrast with the false teachers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"with sound doctrine" or "with correct teachings"
"sober-minded" or "self-controlled"
"in control of their desires"
"healthy"
"with healthy faith" or "correct in their beliefs"
"with healthy love"
"steadfast" or "untiring"
"in the same way." As Titus instructed the older men, He was to instruct the older women as well.
"should prove themselves to be" or "should live as"
This word refers to people who say bad things about other people whether they are true or not.

A person who habitually feels the need to drink alcoholic beverages usually drinks them in great amounts. Paul speaks of addicted persons as if they were slaves. AT: "addicted to wine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
to think correctly
Titus was to train the younger men like he was to train the older people.
"show yourself to be"
"an example of one who does right and proper things"
Paul speaks of Titus' preaching and teaching as if they were a person who was healthy in his body.

tn.ref: so that anyone who is opposed may be put to shame
tn.text: This presents an imaginary situation where someone opposes Titus and then becomes ashamed for having done so. It is not expressing something that actually happened. Your language may have a way of expressing this. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
"their own masters"
"in every situation" or "always"
"make their masters happy" or "satisfy their masters"
steal small things from their master
"demonstrate they are worthy of their masters' trust"
"in everything they do"
Paul speaks of Christian teaching as if it were an object that could be decorated. AT: "make our teaching attractive to other people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"our God who saves us"
Paul encourages Titus to look for Jesus' coming and remember his authority through Jesus.

tn.ref: the grace of God has appeared ... trains us
tn.text: Paul speaks of the grace of God as if it were a person who goes to other people and trains them to live holy lives. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
"teaches us not to dishonor God"
"strong desires for the things of this world" or "strong desires for sinful pleasures"
"while we live in this world" or "during this time"
"We wait to welcome"
Paul means God, in whom we have confidence that he will come to us (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the appearance of the glory of our great God
tn.text: Paul speaks of God's glory so as to imply that God himself will appear. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"gave himself to die for us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: to redeem us from all lawlessness
tn.text: Paul speaks of Jesus as if he were setting slaves free from their evil master. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
A group of people that he treasures.
"have a strong desire"

tn.ref: Speak of and encourage these things
tn.text: "Teach these things and encourage the hearers to do these things"
This statement can be made explicit. AT: "Correct with all authority those people who do not do these things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"Do not allow anyone to"
This statement can be made explicit. AT: "refuse to listen to your words" or "refuse to respect you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
